381 read with Section 34 of the

outcome:
ORDER

Petitioner is the 1% accused in C.C.No.3541/2015 of the
Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Chengannur which has
arisen from Crime No.978/2011 of the Chengannur Police
Station, registered for the offences punishable under
Sections 477A, 408 and 381 read with Section 34 of the
Indian Penal Code.

2. It seems that the matter has been amicably
settled between the parties.

3. On going through the facts and circumstances of
the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be
settled. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents
have been reported against the petitioner. The 3 respondent
has filed Annexure-II affidavit affirming that the matter has
been amicably settled between him and the petitioner and he
has no complaints against the petitioner. Considering the
fact that the matter has already been settled amicably
between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose
would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case.

Bee

ORDER

Petitioner is the 1% accused in C.C.No.3541/2015 of the
Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Chengannur which has
arisen from Crime No.978/2011 of the Chengannur Police
Station, registered for the offences punishable under
Sections 477A, 408 and 381 read with Section 34 of the
Indian Penal Code.

2. It seems that the matter has been amicably
settled between the parties.

3. On going through the facts and circumstances of
the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be
settled. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents
have been reported against the petitioner. The 3 respondent
has filed Annexure-II affidavit affirming that the matter has
been amicably settled between him and the petitioner and he
has no complaints against the petitioner. Considering the
fact that the matter has already been settled amicably
between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose
would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case.

Bee

“2:
Matters being SO, all further proceedings in
C.C.No.3541/2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court, Chengannur which has arisen’ from Crime
No.978/2011 of the Chengannur Police Station against the
petitioner, are liable to be quashed.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further
proceedings in C.C.No.3541/2015 of the Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court, Chengannur which has arisen from Crime
No.978/2011 of the Chengannur Police Station against the
petitioner, are hereby quashed.

Sd/-
B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE.
